abstract.text: Sets a block buffer of media data on a sample buffer.

inlineContent.text: If successful, this operation retains the
. This allows the caller to release the
after calling this API, if it has no further need to reference it. This is a write-once operation; it fails if the

to exist, with timing and format information, before the associated data shows up.Example of usage: Some media services may have access to sample size, timing, and format information before the data is read. Such services may create
with that information and insert them into queues early, and use this API to attach the
later, when the data becomes ready.

abstract.text: Represent time-based audio-visual assets with essential data types.
A reference to a block buffer instance.
A reference to a buffer of media data.
Copies PCM audio data from a sample buffer into an audio buffer list.
Returns an audio buffer list that contains the media data.
Creates an array of audio stream packet descriptions.
Returns a pointer to a constant array of audio stream packet descriptions.
Returns a block buffer that contains the media data.
Returns an image buffer that contains the media data.
Sets a block buffer of media data on a sample buffer.
Creates a block buffer that contains a copy of the data from an audio buffer list.
Errors that occur when processing sample buffer objects.
